Here's the breakdown of the video script into visual beats, with a modern, flat-style infographic asset for each:

The first beat introduces the topic of importing reconditioned cars from Japan. A visual of a car with a Japanese flag element would be suitable.
This visual represents the common misconception that problems arise after the car reaches the port. A car at a port with a "no entry" or "stop" sign could convey this.
This beat highlights that the real problems begin *before* buying the car. A visual showing a car being purchased, but with a question mark or warning sign, would work.
This visual represents skipping important checks. A checklist with some items unchecked or crossed out would be effective.
This beat introduces the "top 7 mistakes." A visual with a prominent number 7 and a warning or mistake icon would be clear.
This visual introduces Carbarn as a solution. A shield or protective barrier with a car and the Carbarn logo (represented by a simple icon) would convey this.
